intro: Dichasianthus brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed dichasianthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. Dichasianthus brevipes is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of cultivation.
